intro: Spigelia anthelmia, commonly known as redroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking red to orange tubular flowers. The plant has a woody root system that is often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Spigelia anthelmia typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swamps.
